key_title: Key to the subspecies of Einadia nutans

leads.lead_text: Leaves ovate to triangular, at least some with sagittate or hastate bases; fruit depressed-globular; fruiting sepals spreading or remaining appressed to berry. Procumbent, sprawling sometimes semi-scandent;  widespread through the State
Leaves linear to narrowly elliptic, without basal lobes; fruit ovoid, fruiting sepals reflexed. Sub-erect with slightly twiggy branches; apparently rare, and confined to a few north-central sites
